meanings.definition: A nut that resists loosening under vibration or torque.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic used locknuts to keep the wheel in place on the car.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to use locknuts when assembling the furniture to prevent any parts from coming loose.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to open the bird feeder, but the locknuts kept the lid shut tight.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like locknuts, unwavering and steadfast in the face of challenges.
meanings.sent5: The locknuts on the gate clicked securely into place, ensuring no one could enter without permission.

meanings.definition: A type of fastener that is used to secure a bolt or screw in place.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter grabbed a handful of locknuts to fasten the new shelf to the wall.
meanings.sent2: When working on the project, remember to use locknuts to keep everything tightly secured.
meanings.sent3: The locknuts danced in the toolbox, eager to be chosen for the important task of holding things together.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as locknuts, anchoring her emotions in a sea of uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The locknuts gleamed in the sunlight, a small but essential part of the construction process.
